scenes.background: [Bob] leans back in his chair after discussing the critical task and necessary break.
scenes.description: Monica raises an eyebrow. 'So, what should we do if another urgent task comes up during your next break?'

options.text: We can set up a rotation system to ensure someone is always available.
options.analysis: You show good social skills by proposing a practical solution but may lack some motivation to directly engage with the situation.

options.text: I'll make sure I'm reachable for truly urgent tasks during my breaks.
options.analysis: You demonstrate responsibility and motivation but might compromise your self-regulation and empathy by overcommitting.

options.text: I think we need to better define what constitutes an 'urgent' task.
options.analysis: You show empathy by seeking clarity but may come off as less proactive and socially skilled.
